title: Saul's Introduction
shortSummary: This chapter introduces Saul, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, who is described as a choice and tall young man. His search for his father's lost donkeys leads him to Samuel, the prophet, who has already been instructed by the Lord to anoint Saul as Israel’s first king, marking a pivotal moment in Israel’s history.
timeline: c. 11th century BC - Early Monarchy Period in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Saul
keyCharacters.description: The son of Kish, a Benjamite, described as a choice and tall young man who will become Israel's first king.

keyCharacters.name: Kish
keyCharacters.description: Saul's father, a mighty man of power from the tribe of Benjamin.

keyCharacters.name: Samuel
keyCharacters.description: The prophet and seer who is instructed by the Lord to anoint Saul as king and who hosts Saul upon his arrival.

keyCharacters.name: Saul’s Servant
keyCharacters.description: The unnamed servant who accompanies Saul in the search for the lost donkeys and suggests seeking the man of God.

definitions.definition: A title used before 'prophet' became common, referring to one who receives and communicates divine revelation.
An ancient unit of silver currency used in Israel, here referring to a small amount of money given to the man of God.
Elevated sites used for worship and sacrifices in ancient Israel, often on hills or mountains.
A term used in the Old Testament to describe a prophet or someone who speaks on behalf of God.

outline.heading: Saul’s Background and the Lost Donkeys
outline.description: The chapter opens by introducing Saul, emphasizing his physical stature and noble character. Saul sets out with a servant to find his father Kish’s lost donkeys, traveling through various regions without success.

outline.heading: Seeking Guidance from the Man of God
outline.description: Saul’s servant suggests consulting the man of God in the city of Zuph, known for receiving and communicating God’s word. They inquire about the seer and learn that Samuel is present to bless a sacrifice.

outline.heading: God’s Foreknowledge and Samuel’s Divine Instruction
outline.description: The Lord reveals to Samuel the coming of Saul, instructing him to anoint Saul as captain over Israel to deliver them from the Philistines, showing God’s sovereign plan in choosing Israel’s first king.

outline.heading: Saul Meets Samuel and Receives Hospitality
outline.description: Saul approaches Samuel, who identifies himself as the seer and invites Saul to eat with him. Samuel reassures Saul about the lost donkeys and hints at Saul’s future leadership over Israel.

outline.heading: Samuel Prepares to Reveal God’s Word to Saul
outline.description: After the meal, Samuel and Saul go to the top of a house where Samuel instructs Saul to wait for God’s revelation, setting the stage for Saul’s anointing and calling.

application: Trust God’s providence even in seemingly small matters, like the search for lost donkeys, as He is working sovereignly behind the scenes.
Seek godly counsel and be willing to follow the guidance of those who speak God’s word faithfully.
Recognize that God often prepares and calls His servants in ways that may be unexpected or humble at first.
Be patient and attentive to God’s timing when awaiting His direction or confirmation in your life.

keyVerses.text: And he had a son, whose name was Saul, a choice young man, and a goodly: and there was not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights Saul’s physical stature and exceptional qualities, setting him apart as a leader chosen by God.

keyVerses.text: To morrow about this time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my people Israel, that he may save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked upon my people, because their cry is come unto me.
keyVerses.significance: God’s sovereign plan to raise up Saul as king and deliverer is revealed here, showing His care for His people.

keyVerses.text: And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom is all the desire of Israel? Is it not on thee, and on all thy father's house?
keyVerses.significance: Samuel redirects Saul’s focus from the lost donkeys to his greater destiny as the chosen leader of Israel.
